alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:32AM EDT until July 14 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HUNTERDON...SOUTH CENTRAL MORRIS AND SOMERSET COUNTIES... At 631 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cloverhill, or 8 miles southwest of Somerville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Somerville, Bridgewater, Bound Brook, Manville, Flemington, Peapack And Gladstone, Far Hills, Millstone, Skillman, Flagtown, Cloverhill, Belle Mead, Martinsville, Millington, White House Station, Bernardsville and Raritan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 23 and 40. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 13 and 27. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
